alert.note: Alert for Cook; DuPage; Lake (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued March 31 at 8:14PM CDT until March 31 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR NORTHWESTERN COOK, NORTHERN DUPAGE AND SOUTHEASTERN LAKE IL COUNTIES... At 814 PM CDT, the public reported ongoing flooding of numerous roadways due to earlier heavy rainfall. Doppler radar indicated another round of thunderstorms moving into the warned area with a rainfall rate of about 1 to 2 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible. Flooding will continue. HAZARD...Significant flash flooding. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Rapid-onset, significant flooding of creeks, streams, drainage ditches, low-lying areas, and poor drainage areas. Widespread street and underpass flooding. Possible flooding of structures. Possible flooding of highways. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Chicago, Aurora, Elgin, Arlington Heights, Evanston, Schaumburg, Palatine, Skokie, Des Plaines, Mount Prospect, Wheaton, Hoffman Estates, Glenview, Elmhurst, Lombard, Buffalo Grove, Bartlett, Ohare Airport, Streamwood and Carol Stream. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...1-2 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
